In preparation for an initial release, I'd like to propose the following
practices to disambiguate IA's use of the crawler from others using
the same codebase:

  - In the template crawler configuration, and any example orders,
    for any particular release, the User-Agent and From headers will
    be set as...

      User-Agent: os-heritrix/#.#.# (+PROJECT_URL)
      From: CONTACT_EMAIL_ADDRESS

    ...where 'os-heritrix' refers to 'open-source heritrix', and #.#.#
    is the actual release number. Code in the crawler will reject
    these values -- insisting on an actual HTTP URL and recognizable
    email address -- so these values will have to be changed by any
    user before crawling, to their own project URL and contact address.

  - Between releases, the User-Agent would be changed to:

      User-Agent: os-heritrix/#.#.#cvs (+PROJECT_URL)

    ...so as to emphasize the CVS origin of the code. (The #.#.#
    version could also be distinct, as per the even-odd numbering
    scheme.)

    Still, anyone working from CVS would need to make local changes
    to these settings before crawling.

  - When doing our own test crawls, we'll use the Heritrix project
    website as the PROJECT_URL and the agent problem email address
    (archive-crawler-agent@...) as the 'From'.

    When doing actual collection-for-the-permanent-archive crawls,
    we would also change the software identifier to read "ia_heritrix".

    We'll have to exert due care (or create automation) to ensure the
    CVS and release configrations are always generic, and our local
    settings remain local.

Sound sensible?

- Gordon

Gordon Mohr wrote (in August):
> FYI, I've added code which imposes a stricter requirement on
> the form of the crawl-order specified "User-Agent" and "From"
> HTTP-headers.
> 
> The "User-Agent" must be of the form...
> 
>   [name] (+[url])[optional-etc]
> 
> ...and the "From" must be a plausible email address. 
> 
> So if your existing crawl-order configurations fail, this is why.
> 
> For our current test crawls, let's use the values...
> 
> <http-headers>
>  <User-Agent>heritrix-aoc/alpha (+http://crawler.archive.org)</User-Agent>
>  <From>archive-crawler-agent@...</From>
> </http-headers>
> 
> - Gordon
